intro: Chukrasia velutina, commonly known as the velvet tree, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and heart-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, fragrant flowers that are yellowish-green in color, followed by orange-yellow fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in various parts of the world.
